{{cpp/title|btowc}}
{{cpp/string/multibyte/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cwchar|
std::wint_t btowc( int c );
}}

Widens a single-byte character {{c|c}} to its wide character equivalent.

Most multibyte character encodings use single-byte codes to represent the characters from the ASCII character set. This function may be used to convert such characters to {{c|wchar_t}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|c|single-byte character to widen}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{lc|WEOF}} if {{c|c}} is {{lc|EOF}}.

Wide character representation of {{c|c}} if {{c|(unsigned char)c}} is a valid single-byte character in the initial shift state, {{lc|WEOF}} otherwise.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;cwchar&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

void try_widen(char c)
{
    std::wint_t w = std::btowc(c);
    if (w != WEOF)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The single-byte character " &lt;&lt; +(unsigned char)c
                  &lt;&lt; " widens to " &lt;&lt; +w &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The single-byte character " &lt;&lt; +(unsigned char)c
                  &lt;&lt; " failed to widen\n";
}

int main()
{
    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "lt_LT.iso88594");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::showbase &lt;&lt; "In Lithuanian ISO-8859-4 locale:\n";
    try_widen('A');
    try_widen('\xdf'); // German letter ß (U+00df) in ISO-8859-4
    try_widen('\xf9'); // Lithuanian letter ų (U+0173) in ISO-8859-4

    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "lt_LT.utf8");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "In Lithuanian UTF-8 locale:\n";
    try_widen('A');
    try_widen('\xdf');
    try_widen('\xf9');
}
|p=true
|output=
In Lithuanian ISO-8859-4 locale:
The single-byte character 0x41 widens to 0x41
The single-byte character 0xdf widens to 0xdf
The single-byte character 0xf9 widens to 0x173
In Lithuanian UTF-8 locale:
The single-byte character 0x41 widens to 0x41
The single-byte character 0xdf failed to widen
The single-byte character 0xf9 failed to widen
}}
